alert.note: Alert for Clermont (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 3:34PM EDT until May 06 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of Northern Kentucky and Southwest Ohio, including the following counties, in Northern Kentucky, Campbell and Kenton. In Southwest Ohio, Clermont. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 PM EDT, the public reported minor flooding in Several locations in advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Independence, Alexandria, Taylor Mill, Claryville, New Richmond, Neville, Cold Spring, Ryland Heights, Mentor, Moscow, California, Chilo, Campbell County Lake, Gubser Mill, Aspen Grove, Grants Lick, White Villa, Visalia and Morning View.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. To report flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
